comment_data.body: AFAIR validation is done in `DartGeneratorPeer#validate`. PR is welcome or I'll fix it myself some day. Tracked as https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-15525

Actually @alexander-doroshko , https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-15525 is a little different.  We have even more draconian checks for Flutter projects and need to update `FlutterSmallIDEGeneratorPeer`.  Having said that, I wonder if you could advise.  Is there any way to get access to the project location during validation?  I tried caching `WizardContext` but it's not set and I can't see any other way to access the project name.

Thanks in advance for any pointers!
Thanks for investigation! Then I'm afraid I do not know. If you can't control WebStorm project name you can normalize it when using it as a Flutter project name.
@alexander-doroshko : could you elaborate?  I'm not quite sure what you mean by normalizing and not sure when we would do it.  Thanks!

Do you call a flutter tool to generate sample project content? Does it take a Flutter project name as a parameter or it simply uses the current folder name? In the former case you have a control on the Flutter project name (but not on IntelliJ project name or on folder name).

Yes.  We do call out to `flutter create`.  It hadn't occurred to me to allow for the project and folder names to be different (since that seems potentially confusing) but I guess it's an option.  Thanks!

milestone.description: Work triaged but not yet planned for a specific release.
milestone.title: Backlog

title: Project name validation for WebStorm.
